ollama_forge package¶

Submodules¶

ollama_forge.cli module¶

Command Line Interface for Ollama Forge. 🎯🌟 Eidosian synergy: minimal redundancy, immediate utility.

ollama_forge.cli.main(args=None)[source]¶

Main entry point for the CLI with perfect flow control.

Parameters:

args (Optional[List[str]]) – Command line arguments (uses sys.argv if None)

Return type:

int

Returns:

Exit code (0 for success)

ollama_forge.client module¶

class ollama_forge.client.OllamaClient(base_url='http://localhost:11434', timeout=120, max_retries=3, session=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Client for interacting with the Ollama API.

This class provides a comprehensive interface to all Ollama API endpoints, with support for both synchronous and asynchronous requests, streaming responses, and robust error handling.

base_url[source]¶

Base URL for the Ollama API

timeout[source]¶

Request timeout in seconds

max_retries[source]¶

Maximum number of retries for failed requests

async achat(model, messages, options=None, stream=False)[source]¶
Return type:

Union[Dict[str, Any], AsyncIterator[Dict[str, Any]]]

async acreate_embedding(model, prompt, options=None)[source]¶
Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

async agenerate(model, prompt, options=None, stream=False)[source]¶
Return type:

Union[Dict[str, Any], AsyncIterator[Dict[str, Any]]]

batch_embeddings(model, prompts, options=None, show_progress=False)[source]¶

Create embeddings for multiple prompts.

Parameters:

  • model (str) – Name of the model

  • prompts (List[str]) – List of texts to create embeddings for

  • options (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – Optional embedding parameters

  • show_progress (bool) – Whether to show a progress bar

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

Returns:

List of embedding vectors

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ModelNotFoundError – If the model does not exist

chat(model, messages, options=None, stream=False)[source]¶

Chat with a model.

Parameters:

  • model (str) – Name of the model

  • messages (List[Dict[str, str]]) – List of message dictionaries (role, content)

  • options (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – Chat options

  • stream (bool) – Whether to stream the response

Return type:

Union[Dict[str, Any], Iterator[Dict[str, Any]]]

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding response chunks If stream=False, a dictionary with the complete response

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ModelNotFoundError – If the model does not exist

  • InvalidRequestError – If the messages format is invalid

copy_model(source, destination)[source]¶

Copy a model.

Parameters:

  • source (str) – Source model name

  • destination (str) – Destination model name

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Dictionary with operation result

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ModelNotFoundError – If the source model does not exist

  • InvalidRequestError – If the destination name is invalid

create_embedding(model, prompt, options=None)[source]¶

Create an embedding vector for a text prompt.

Parameters:

  • model (str) – Name of the model

  • prompt (str) – Text to create embedding for

  • options (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – Optional embedding parameters

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Dictionary with the embedding vector

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ModelNotFoundError – If the model does not exist

create_model(name, modelfile, stream=True)[source]¶

Create a new model from a Modelfile.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name for the new model

  • modelfile (str) – Modelfile content

  • stream (bool) – Whether to stream the creation progress

Return type:

Union[Dict[str, Any], Iterator[Dict[str, Any]]]

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding progress updates If stream=False, a dictionary with creation result

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • InvalidRequestError – If the Modelfile is invalid

delete_model(model)[source]¶

Delete a model.

Parameters:

model (str) – Name of the model to delete

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if successful

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ModelNotFoundError – If the model does not exist

fallback_context(prompt, system_prompt=None)[source]¶

Context manager for automatic model fallback.

Parameters:

  • prompt (str) – The user’s query or message

  • system_prompt (Optional[str]) – Optional system prompt to use

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Context dictionary with parameters

Example

```python with client.fallback_context(“chat”):

response = client.chat(model, messages)

```

generate(model, prompt, options=None, stream=False)[source]¶

Generate text from a prompt.

Parameters:

  • model (str) – Name of the model to use

  • prompt (str) – The prompt to generate from

  • options (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – Dictionary of generation options

  • stream (bool) – Whether to stream the response

Return type:

Union[Dict[str, Any], Iterator[Dict[str, Any]]]

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding response chunks If stream=False, a dictionary with the complete response

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ModelNotFoundError – If the model does not exist

  • InvalidRequestError – If the request is invalid

get_fallback_info()[source]¶

Get information about the current fallback state.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Dictionary containing fallback depth, model name, and original error

get_version()[source]¶

Get the Ollama server version.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Dictionary with version information

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • OllamaAPIError – If the response is invalid

list_models()[source]¶

List available models.

Return type:

Dict[str, List[Dict[str, Any]]]

Returns:

Dictionary with models information

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • OllamaAPIError – If the response is invalid

pull_model(model, stream=True)[source]¶

Pull a model from the Ollama registry.

Parameters:

  • model (str) – Name of the model to pull

  • stream (bool) – Whether to stream the progress

Return type:

Union[Dict[str, Any], Generator[Dict[str, Any], None, None]]

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding progress updates If stream=False, a dictionary with pull result

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • InvalidRequestError – If the model name is invalid

  • OllamaAPIError – If the response is invalid

ollama_forge.config module¶

Configuration module for Ollama Forge.

This module serves as the central source of truth for all configuration parameters and versioning information used throughout the package. It embodies the Eidosian principles of Structure as Control and Contextual Integrity.

Every constant, function, and docstring here stands on its own yet interlocks seamlessly with the larger system—a fractal reflection of purpose and clarity.

ollama_forge.config.calculate_context_size()[source]¶

Calculate optimal context size - more RAM = bigger thoughts! 🧠

Return type:

int

Return type:

int

Configure optimal log level based on environment. 📊

Return type:

str

Configure progress bars for optimal user experience. 📊

Return type:

bool

Configure user directories based on platform. 🗂️

Return type:

Dict[str, str]

Return a formatted author string with optimal caching. 👥

Return type:

str

Return type:

int

  • key (str) – Key to look up

  • default (Optional[TypeVar(T)]) – Value to return if key is missing

Optional[TypeVar(T)]

Returns:

int

  • value (Any) – New value to set

Return type:

bool

Returns:

ollama_forge.exceptions module¶

Exception classes for Ollama Forge.

This module defines a precise, hierarchical exception system to provide detailed and actionable error information with perfect granularity. Following Eidosian principles of structure as control, contextual integrity, and precision as style.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when a connection to the Ollama server cannot be established.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when the request is invalid (4xx error).

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when the requested model does not exist.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaAPIError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Base exception for all Ollama API errors.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaConnectionError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: ConnectionError

Legacy alias for ConnectionError for backwards compatibility.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaModelNotFoundError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: ModelNotFoundError

Legacy alias for ModelNotFoundError for backwards compatibility.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaServerError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: ServerError

Legacy alias for ServerError for backwards compatibility.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.ParseError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when parsing a response fails.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.ServerError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when the Ollama server returns a 5xx error.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.StreamingError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when an error occurs during streaming responses.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.TimeoutError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when a request to the Ollama server times out.

exception ollama_forge.exceptions.ValidationError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when input validation fails.

ollama_forge.exceptions.get_exception_for_status(status_code, message, response=None)[source]¶

Get the appropriate exception class for an HTTP status code.

Parameters:

  • status_code (int) – HTTP status code

  • message (str) – Error message

  • response (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – Optional response data

Return type:

OllamaAPIError

Returns:

Instantiated exception of the appropriate type

Module contents¶

Ollama Forge - Python client library and CLI for Ollama

This package provides a comprehensive set of helpers for interacting with Ollama, following all ten Eidosian principles for elegant, efficient, and effective code.

Key Features: - Complete API coverage - Synchronous and asynchronous interfaces - Smart model fallbacks - CLI helpers - Embedding utilities

exception ollama_forge.ConnectionError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when a connection to the Ollama server cannot be established.

exception ollama_forge.InvalidRequestError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when the request is invalid (4xx error).

exception ollama_forge.ModelNotFoundError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: OllamaAPIError

Raised when the requested model does not exist.

exception ollama_forge.OllamaAPIError(message, response=None)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Base exception for all Ollama API errors.
